slot.description: If specified, this will check how many powers are assigned to this equipment slot. Accepts one of `"head"`, `"chest"`, `"legs"`, `"feet"`, `"mainhand"` or `"offhand"`.
slot.markdownDescription: If specified, this will check how many powers are assigned to this equipment slot. Accepts one of `"head"`, `"chest"`, `"legs"`, `"feet"`, `"mainhand"` or `"offhand"`.

comparison.description: Determines how the amount of powers embedded in the item is compared to the specified value.
comparison.markdownDescription: Determines how the amount of powers embedded in the item is compared to the specified value.

compare_to.description: The value to compare the amount of powers embedded in the item to.
compare_to.markdownDescription: The value to compare the amount of powers embedded in the item to.

type.description:
## Power Count --- [Item Condition Type](https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/item_condition_types/power_count) Checks how many powers are embedded in the item. Type ID: `origins:power_count` --- ### Examples ```json "item_condition": { "type": "origins:power_count", "comparison": ">", "compare_to": 0 } ``` This example will check if the item has more than 0 powers embedded in it.
```json "item_condition": { "type": "origins:power_count", "slot": "mainhand", "comparison": "<", "compare_to": 10 } ``` This example will check if the item has less than 10 powers embedded in it.
type.markdownDescription:
undefined## Power Count --- [Item Condition Type](https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/item_condition_types/power_count) Checks how many powers are embedded in the item. Type ID: `origins:power_count` --- ### Examples ```json "item_condition": { "type": "origins:power_count", "comparison": ">", "compare_to": 0 } ``` This example will check if the item has more than 0 powers embedded in it.
```json "item_condition": { "type": "origins:power_count", "slot": "mainhand", "comparison": "<", "compare_to": 10 } ``` This example will check if the item has less than 10 powers embedded in it.
